name: jure.html
text: conflicts detected. Replacement of CELEX identifiers by short titles - experimental feature. It replaces clickable CELEX identifiers of treaties and case-law by short titles. Visualisation of document relationships. It displays a dynamic graph with relations between the act and related documents. It is currently only available for legal acts. Deep linking. It enables links to other legal acts referred to within the documents. It is currently only available for documents smaller than 900 KB. text: single character in your search term to find variations of it (ca ? e finds case, cane, care). Search tips Need more search options? Use the Advanced search Help Export PDF Print JURE case-law Search in JURE case-law Recently published JURE case-law JURE stands for jurisdiction, recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters. In this section you can find relevant judgments on judicial cooperation in civil and commercial matters delivered by: courts in the contracting states of the Lugano Convention (EU Member States*, Iceland, Norway and Switzerland), and * including the United Kingdom until the end of the transition period on 31.12.2020, as provided for in the Withdrawal Agreement. the Court of Justice of the European Union. Judgments by national courts are available in their original language only, but: some may also be accompanied by a summary in English, French and German ( if the country in question provides one ). an automatic translation tool is available to translate judgments and summaries of judgments into any official EU language. How to search in this section The left-hand side of this page gives access to search tools. Search in JURE case-law redirects to an advanced search form that

name: jure.html
text: question provides one ). an automatic translation tool is available to translate judgments and summaries of judgments into any official EU language. How to search in this section The left-hand side of this page gives access to search tools. Search in JURE case-law redirects to an advanced search form that offers many options. Searches will be performed only within the remit of the “JURE case-law” section. The Recently published search gives access to all the documents published in this section in the last 14 days. More on JURE case-law Less on JURE case-law The JURE case–law collection was created under Article 3 of Protocol 2 of the 2007 Lugano Convention . That article required the European Commission to set up a publicly accessible system containing relevant judgments delivered under that Convention and other instruments that have an influence on its application. Over time, the collection has been expanded and now contains judgments under the following: Brussels Convention - civil and commercial matters (1968) Lugano Convention - civil and commercial matters (1988) Brussels I Regulation - civil and commercial matters (2000) Brussels II Regulation - matrimonial matters and matters of parental responsibility for children of both spouses (2000) New Brussels II
